A temple, underneath its hollow dome

line.del: Poised on twelve columns of resplendent stone,

zone.line: And Around stand Asia & the Earth & thou

line.del: Prometheus, and the sisters of the Sea
In memory of the tidings it has borne

zone.line: Phidian
And gazed upon by living statues forms, around
Of thee, and Asia & the Earth, & me
Andthou fair nymphs, looking the love we feel
yo u which graven flowers
Beneath a dome fretted with carven
Poised on twelve columns of resplendent stone
And open to the [all]-surrounding Heaven
In memory of the tidings it has borne
Yoked to it by an amphisbaenic snake
430 And Drawn by the likeness of those winged steed s
The likeness of those winged steeds will make
The flight from which they find repose—alas
Withe Wither has wandered now my partial tongue
When all remains unsaid which ye w.dhear!—
As I have said I floated to the Earth
